summary: a cross-sectional study design was used to recruit 578 male Saudi primary school children, aged 6–8 years, from 12 primary schools in five different regions of Riyadh. children were clinically screened to detect carious lesions in primary teeth according to world health organisation’s criteria. dental caries were prevalent among children (83%, 95% confidence interval 79.7–86.0%) selected from all four risk domains at different steps of model selection process*.
